name: Sumo Squats
how_to_perform:
* Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, turning your toes outwards slightly to form a soft V-shape with your body.

* Lower yourself into a seated position by bending both knees, keeping them behind your toes. Your back should remain straight and engaged throughout the movement.

* Keep your weight evenly distributed on both feet as you sink deeper into the squat.

* Use this moment to stretch your glutes, lower back, and calves while feeling the engagement in your leg muscles.

* Stand up to the starting position by pushing through your heels, extending your legs fully. Keep your core engaged for stability and control throughout.

* Repeat for a specified number of repetitions, maintaining proper form and engaging your leg muscles with each squat.
short_summary: Sumo squats are an exercise primarily targeting the glutes and legs while improving flexibility in the lower back and calves.
